1.text: And Bildad the Shuhite will answer and say,

2.text: How long wilt thou speak these things? and the great spirit of the words of thy mouth?

3.text: Will God pervert judgment? and if the Almighty will pervert justice?

4.text: If thy sons sinned to him, and he will send them away by the hand of their transgression;

5.text: If thou shalt seek to God, if thou shalt make supplication to him;

6.text: If thou wert pure and upright, for now he will awake for thee and requite the habitation of thy justice.

7.text: And thy beginning was small, and thy latter state shall increase greatly.

8.text: For ask now to the first generation, and prepare to seek their fathers:

9.text: (For yesterday are we and we shall not know, for our days upon earth are a shadow:)

10.text: Shall they not teach thee, and say to thee, and bring forth words from their heart?

11.text: Shall the bulrush lift itself up without a marsh? shall the marsh grass grow without water?

12.text: While yet in its greenness it shall not break off, and it will dry up before grass.

13.text: So the paths of all forgetting God and the hope of the profane one shall perish.

14.text: Which his hope shall be cut off, and the spiderâ€™s house his trust.

15.text: He shall lean upon his house and it shall not stand: he shall hold fast upon it, and it shall not rise up.

16.text: It was moist before the sun, and its sprout will come forth upon his garden.

17.text: His roots were entwined upon a heap, he shall see a house of stones.

18.text: If he should swallow him down from his place, and it lied upon it: I saw thee not.

19.text: Behold, this the rejoicing of his way, and from the dust shall they cause another to grow.

20.text: Behold, God will not reject the blameless one, and he will not take hold upon the hand of those doing evil:

21.text: Till he shall fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with shouts of joy.

22.text: They hating thee shall put on shame; and the tent of the unjust shall not be.
